question: 縛り首
sourceMnemonic: Remember how <ja>縛る</ja> means "to tie?" Well if you tie something around someone's <kanji>neck</kanji> then it's called <vocabulary>hanging</vocabulary>. They'll probably die from it too, so it can also be <vocabulary>death by hanging</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a combination of the words <ja>縛る</ja> and <ja>首</ja>. Both use the kun'yomi readings, so just change the <ja>る</ja> to <ja>り</ja> and it's pretty simple!
